Description: Rim sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below with two added white bands; exterior: white slip; narrow black line at top of rim and billet pattern below; painted decoration consisting of part of head of goat (eye, muzzle and goatee) to right.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the sherd belongs in the Wild Goat Style however, the only element consistent with this style is the goat. Goats typically fall out of favour after the Wild Goat Style in circa 610BC but they do surface occasionally on later chalices as well. For example, London UCL 167 and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA72 and NA103. The rim pattern, the lack of filling ornament and the interior decoration are all consistent with the Simple Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 252, no. 389, pl. 55)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1035) (phase 2)
